title: Add script to check formatting of TODOs in go code
body:
We would like to start enforcing the format of `TODO(1234)` for TODOs in our code where 1234 represents the github issue associated with that task.

The requirements for this issue are to add a script to travis that will complain if there are any issues incorrectly formatted. See [scripts/check_gazelle.sh](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/master/scripts/check_gazelle.sh) for inspiration. 

A prerequesite to submitting a fix for this issue would be that all of the TODOs are correctly formatted. Creating issues for the existing TODOs should be done by the original code owner (see git blame). The assignee of this issue should ping original owners to create issues for the respective TODOs. 

I've written a quick regex and there are many TODOs that need an issue or need to be deleted.

```bash
grep -PinH '(?<!context\.)todo(?!\(#{0,1}\d+\))' **/*.go
```
```
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:224:    // TODO: Insert recent block hash.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:261:    // TODO: Validate last justified block hash matches in the crystallizedState.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:275:    // TODO: Generate validators aggregated pub key.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:295:    // TODO: Verify msgHash against aggregated pub key and aggregated signature.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:365:    // TODO: ShardAndCommitteesForSlots will return default value because the spec for dynasty transition is not finalized.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:452:    // TODO: Full rewards and penalties design is not finalized according to the spec.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:468:            Validators:                 rewardedValidators, // TODO: Stub. Static validator set because dynasty transition is not finalized according to the spec.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:470:            ShardAndCommitteesForSlots: cState.ShardAndCommitteesForSlots(), // TODO: Stub. This will be addresses by shuffling during dynasty transition.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:474:            CrosslinkingStartShard:     0, // TODO: Stub. Need to see where this epoch left off.
beacon-chain/blockchain/core.go:476:            DynastySeedLastReset:       cState.DynastySeedLastReset(), // TODO: Stub. Dynasty transition is not finalized according to the spec.
beacon-chain/blockchain/service.go:85:  // TODO: Fetch the slot: (block, state) DAGs from persistent storage
beacon-chain/blockchain/service.go:174: // TODO: Implement real fork choice rule here.
beacon-chain/blockchain/service.go:184: // TODO: Utilize this value in the fork choice rule.
beacon-chain/blockchain/service.go:342:                 // TODO: Using latest block hash for seed, this will eventually be replaced by randao.
beacon-chain/node/p2p_config.go:29:     // TODO(437, 438): Define default adapters for logging, monitoring, etc.
beacon-chain/rpc/service.go:119:        // TODO: Implement the real method by fetching the crystallized state in the request
beacon-chain/rpc/service.go:134:        // TODO: handle fields such as attestation bitmask, aggregate sig, and randao reveal.
beacon-chain/rpc/service.go:153:// TODO: needs implementation.
beacon-chain/rpc/service.go:155:        // TODO: implement.
beacon-chain/simulator/service.go:201:                  // TODO: Handle this at p2p layer.
beacon-chain/sync/initial-sync/service.go:108:          // TODO: Bail out of the sync service if the chain is only partially synced.
beacon-chain/sync/initial-sync/service.go:150:                          // TODO: Resume sync after completion of initial sync.
beacon-chain/sync/initial-sync/service.go:156:                  // TODO: Handle this at p2p layer.
beacon-chain/sync/initial-sync/service.go:190:                  // TODO: Handle this at p2p layer.
beacon-chain/sync/service.go:88:                // TODO: Resume sync after completion of initial sync.
beacon-chain/sync/service.go:141:                       // TODO: Handle this at p2p layer.
beacon-chain/sync/service.go:149:                       // TODO: Handle this at p2p layer.
beacon-chain/types/block.go:43:// TODO: Add more default fields.
beacon-chain/types/state.go:61: // TODO: Perform this task from some sort of genesis state json config instead.
shared/database/database.go:30: // TODO: allow these arguments to be set based on cli context.
```

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. **Done** 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 2 months, 2 weeks from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [zachzundel](https://gitcoin.co/profile/zachzundel) has been approved to start work.**

Write a script that does the following:
1) Finds any invalid TODOs
2) runs git blame on those lines
3) prints output

It will return a failing error code if any invalid TODOs are found, notifying Travis CI of the failure. 

Before I put the script in Travis, I will ping the git blame'd owners of current TODOs to see if they need to open an issue on GitHub or delete the TODO.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/prysmaticlabs/prysm/497/1212).


**2) [michaelnetbiz](https://gitcoin.co/profile/michaelnetbiz) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/prysmaticlabs/prysm/497/1212?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=michaelnetbiz) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/prysmaticlabs/prysm/497/1212?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=michaelnetbiz))_.**

First, I'll write a script that will report violations in a given repository of the specified TODO formatting requirements. It will output an exit code and the location and authorship information of any TODO formatting problems in a repository. Next, I'll use the script to identify existing TODO owners to contact with a request to either remove or create issues for their TODOs. Finally, the script will be added to the repository's build process, such that the process succeeds only where there are no TODO formatting problems.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/prysmaticlabs/prysm/497/1212).

Zach’s proposal sounds good. We don’t really need git blame as part of the script since we wouldn’t allow any new improperly formatted comments to be introduced, but I suppose it could be helpful for the existing issues.

Make sure it exits non-zero so it will cause a failure on Travis if there is an improper comment.

Thanks!

For example, [this TODO](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/8bfed4897f02e50149d948a8836c55691b1473d0/beacon-chain/blockchain/service.go#L74) points to a closed issue. Would be nice if this could be detected!
I think that would be a great feature! I don't think we can ask that as part of this task since it's already been funded and started.

I wouldn’t mind doing it in another task.
